revised_title: The Influence of Stress and Strain on the Physical Properties of Metals
tldr: The author investigates the effects of stress and strain on the elasticity and electrical resistance of metals, focusing on the loss of energy experienced by a wire during torsional vibration. The results suggest that the internal resistance to change of shape in solids and liquids depends on the rapidity of the change, and that the loss of energy is not solely due to molecular friction or elastic afterworking.
